data.title: Fatal Exception java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException ndroidMultiTouchHandler.java line 48 com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidMultiTouchHandler.onTouch
Decoupling of AndroidApplication logic from Activity (removing inheritance, using delegation)
data.body:
## Background

Our project SleepFighter https://github.com/Hasselmannen/sleepfighter
is an alarm app for android that uses mini-games ("Challenge") that needs OpenGL/libgdx
for some Challenges - others use MathML.
We've an activity that spawns these games (ChallengeActivity): https://github.com/Hasselmannen/sleepfighter/blob/master/application/src/se/toxbee/sleepfighter/activity/ChallengeActivity.java
The interface for a Challenge is: https://github.com/Hasselmannen/sleepfighter/blob/master/application/src/se/toxbee/sleepfighter/challenge/Challenge.java

Since all challenges don't use libgdx, it is unacceptable for ChallengeActivity to extend AndroidApplication.
I'd rather send in the ChallengeActivity to AndroidApplication.
## Changes

Since alot of projects rely on AndroidApplication being an activity.
I haven't changed that mechanism, but rather I moved the code in AndroidApplication to AndroidApplicationBackend and let AndroidApplication still be an activity but delegate to AndroidApplicationBackend.

Avoiding inheritance for these cases is sound OOD 

I don't know any other way to solve this.
This solution allows for complete backwards compatibility.

I agree that the use case might be rare - but the performance impact of the changes should be slim to nill since people shouldn't call getGraphics(), and such methods in loops but rather store the value of such a call in a local field.

I sent a mail signing the CLA btw =)

data.title: OpenAL: Close InputStream when loading Sound
data.body:
I want the InputStream returned by file.read() to be closed.
Using try/finally to ensure it is closed in case of exceptions.
Construction of OggInputStream intentionally moved inside the try's scope.

data.title: Android 4.4 KitKat 'Immersive Mode' Missing
data.body: Something that should definitely be added to LibGDX

data.title: Made libgdx version configurable in gdx-setup
data.body: Added a new flag "--gdxVersion" to specify the version that will be added in the build.gradle, if not present it will use the stable 0.9.9 version. Also includes a list of valid versions.

data.title: Various small changes
data.body:
Just a few small changes I had pending:
- Matrix4: add setTranslation with floats
- Frustum: add methods with float signature
- StringBuilder: allow minimum length (prefix)

data.title: Scene2D: Group scaling prevents children of being drawn
Added Triangle class and updated Intersector and ShapeRenderer
data.body:
I added a Triangle class, which encapsulates a 2D Triangle defined by it's three points (A, B and C).
ShapeRenderer and Intersector now also support the Triangle class. In addition, ShapeRenderer now also supports directly called functions with object types Rectangle and Circle. (See source code below)

I'm kinda new to all this git and github, so please let me know if I did anything wrong(I tried my best). I would like to have some feedback :)

After looking at my commits, I should have written the class, which supports what. Can you change that afterwards?
